title: Memoirs of the life and writings of Thomas Chalmers...
author: Hanna, William
snippet: * The late Sir Alexander Gibson Carmichael, Bart, of Skirling, who, dying too soon for his country and his friends, gave so many affecting evidences on his deathbed  of the triumphs of Christian faith.

title: Memoirs of the life and writings of Thomas Chalmers...
author: Hanna, William
snippet: I should like if I could come soon to Skirling.

title: Memoirs of the life and writings of Thomas Chalmers...
author: Hanna, William
snippet: " MY DEAR LITTLE TOMMY, Why do you like your hobbyhorse  better than grandpapa ?* You tell me because it is bigger  than him ; but so are the haystack and the hill that you sec from the window, and any house in the village, these arc all bigger than grandpapa, and will you tell me that you don't like grandpapa so well as you do a house, or a hill, or a haystack  ! And besides, the hobby-horse cannot write letters to j r ou like grandpapa, neither can he buy toys for you and send them from Edinburgh to Skirling 1 ; neither can he show you pictures, or do for you any of those things which you best like.

title: Memoirs of the life and writings of Thomas Chalmers...
author: Hanna, William
snippet: He spent the Christmas holidays of the following winter with the writer of these pages in the parish of Skirling in Peebles-shire.

title: The complete poetical and prose works of Robert Burns:
author: Burns, Robert
